item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The impossible often has a kind of integrity to it which the merely improbable lacks." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Henry Fielding
item.description: "We would bestow some pains here in minutely describing all the mad pranks which Jones played on this occasion could we be well assured that the reader would take the same pains in perusing them, but as we are apprehensive that after all the labour which we should employ in painting this scene the said reader would be very apt to skip it entirely over, we have saved ourself that trouble. To say the truth, we have from this reason alone often done great violence to the luxuriance of our genius, and have left many excellent descriptions out of our work which would otherwise have been in it." -- Henry Fielding

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "She was a lucky woman who had established a happy knack of writing what quite a lot of people wanted to read." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Nothing travels faster than the speed of light, with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Better be without sense than misapply it as you do. " -- Jane Austen

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "We see with our eyes. We know with our hearts. Outside...Inside." -- Jim Henson

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Cantus
item.description: "There are no rules, and those are the rules." -- Cantus

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "There's not a word yet, for old friends who've just met." -- Jim Henson

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "If it looks like a duck, and quacks like a duck, we have at least to consider the possibility that we have a small aquatic bird of the family anatidae on our hands." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "You live and learn. At any rate, you live." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "He hoped and prayed that there wasn't an afterlife. Then he realized there was a contradiction involved here and merely hoped that there wasn't an afterlife." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "All you really need to know for the moment is that the universe is a lot more complicated than you might think, even if you start from a position of thinking it's pretty damn complicated in the first place." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Capital Letters Were Always The Best Way Of Dealing With Things You Didn't Have A Good Answer To." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "If you try and take a cat apart to see how it works, the first thing you have on your hands is a non-working cat." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I think fish is nice, but then I think that rain is wet, so who am I to judge?" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Black holes are where God divided by zero." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company." -- Mark Twain

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed." -- Mark Twain

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Education: the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty." -- Mark Twain

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Part of the secret of success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside." -- Mark Twain

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Nothing ever fatigues me, but doing what I do not like." -- Jane Austen

item.title: 2bnallegory add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless." -- Mother Teresa
